availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Established as an anti-Jackson newspaper in Lexington, Kentucky in 1831. The next year, united with the Kentucky Reporter, founded in 1807 by William W. Worsley and Samuel R. Overton, to become the consolidated Kentucky Reporter and Lexington Observer. Continued as the "Observer and Reporter" until after July 1868., when sold to a company. Ceased to exist in 1873.

bibl.p: Peter, Robert, M.D., History of Fayette County, Kentucky, (Chicago: O.L. Baskin & Co., Historical Publishers, 1882), 366-369, https://books.google.com/books?id=9YhAAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA429&dq=history+of+fayette+county+ky&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjJwurQwcvVAhWL3YMKHaUvBI0Q6AEIJjAA#v=snippet&q=editors&f=false (accessed 9 Aug 2017).
